item.title: Report E-2025010082
item.description:
Report E-2025010082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 19:35 EST on 12/12, Dan with XPO-XSB contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 10 gallons of "ACTIVATOR" from 2x 5gal metal pails impacting the trailer and dock floors. The pails were punctured by a forklift at XSB. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor assist with additional PPE, citing goggles. Placed the (2) 5-gallon pails in 55-gallon metal drum and staged for terminal management to handle.

item.title: Report E-2025010080
item.description:
Report E-2025010080

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a nail in the trailer that resulted in the drum being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 65-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120515
item.description:
Report E-2024120515

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: MARKLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to blocking and bracing that resulted in the pails being crushed. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010010
item.description:
Report E-2025010010

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately eight (8) ounces of material released from one (1) 50-pound box due to a forklift puncturing the box cause it to leak. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010066
item.description:
Report E-2025010066

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the concrete terminal floor and estimated that three (3) ounces of material was released due to a defective weld seam on one (1) 275-gallon metal tote. Hepaco personnel stated that granular absorbents had been applied and slightly impacted. The impacted absorbents were collected and taken offsite for Hepaco to dispose of. The remaining product was transferred to a new tote.
